ai.summary: A demanding 20.7 km loop around Harewoods Lodge Farm Walk in the UK. This hard hike traverses farmland tracks and woodland with varying elevation, requiring solid stamina and good navigation.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain including farm tracks, grassy fields, muddy paths, woodland trails and occasional stiles. Surfaces can be uneven and slippery, especially after rain; expect exposed sections along hedged lanes and variable footing.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long, strenuous walk. Bring a map or navigation app, fully charged phone, and a route plan. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and dress for changing UK weather. Stay on public rights of way, watch for livestock, gates and stiles, and take extra care on muddy or slippery sections. Tell someone your route and expected return time. Carry water, snacks, basic first aid, a whistle, and a light source if there’s a chance you’ll be out near dusk.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate layers (including a waterproof outer layer)
Map and compass or offline navigation app
Fully charged phone and portable charger
Lightweight rain jacket and pack cover
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) for the best conditions; winter hikes are possible but expect mud, reduced daylight and colder weather.
